bill_title: provide free tuition for a resident whose parent died while on active duty in the United States armed forces.

bill_versions.bill_text: An Act to provide free tuition for a resident whose parent died while on active duty in the United States armed forces. Be it enacted by the Legislature of the State of South Dakota: Section 1. That § 13-55-10 be AMENDED: 13-55-10. Any resident of this state who is less than twenty-five years of age and whose parent has died or has sustained a total disability, permanent in nature, resulting from duty as a member of the South Dakota National Guard, while on state or federal active duty or any authorized training duty, or whose parent died while on active duty as a member of the United States armed forces, is entitled to tuition without cost and is entitled to attend any course or courses of study in any state educational institution of higher education under the control and management of the Board of Regents. Any person who is a resident of this state whose spouse has died or has sustained a total disability, permanent in nature, resulting from duty as a member of the South Dakota National Guard, while on state or federal active duty or any authorized training duty, or whose spouse died while on active duty as a member of the United States armed forces, is entitled to tuition without cost and is entitled to attend any course or courses of study in any state educational institution of higher education under the control and management of the Board of Regents. The application and receipt of the benefits of this section are governed by the provisions of §§ 13-55-6 to 13-55-9, inclusive.

action_log.status_text: First read in Senate and referred to
